Documentation

You will find in this document details on how to use our icon font and a list of useful helper classes.

Add our icon font to your website

  1. Copy the entire pe-icon-set-weather directory into your project.
  2. In the <head> of your html, reference the location to our icon font CSS: pe-icon-set-weather.cssand if needed helper CSS: helper.css. 
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="path/to/pe-icon-set-weather/css/pe-icon-set-weather.css">

<!-- Optional - Adds useful class to manipulate icon font display -->
<link rel="stylesheet" href="path/to/pe-icon-set-weather/css/helper.css">

Place the icons in your HTML

pe-is-w-degree-celsius
pe-is-w-degree-fahrenheit

Easiest way is to place your icon inline using a html tag such as <span> or <i> 

<span class="pe-is-w-degree-celsius"></span> pe-is-w-degree-celsius
<i class="pe-is-w-degree-fahrenheit"></span> pe-is-w-degree-fahrenheit

icon unicode is added with CSS and the pseudo-class :before.

Compatible with Icomoon font creator tool

The IcoMoon app lets you build and use your own icon sets: IcoMoon App.
You can import icomoon/*selection.json*in the IcoMoon app using the *Import Icons* button (or via Main Menu > Manage Projects) to retrieve this specific icon font.
This way you can mix and match our icon font with other fonts or select only the icons you need and generate a new font.

Helper classes based on font-awesome useful classes (optional)

Below you will find a list of useful classes to modify the icon display, layout, sizes etc... They come with the helper.css file and are based on a modified version of font-awesome classes.Important: if you already use font-awesome (FA) icon font in your website, you might want to delete the classes in the helper file under /* FA based classes */ and use the FA classes instead.

Larger Icons & Vertical Align

pe-is-w-umbrella

pe-is-w-umbrella

pe-is-w-umbrella

pe-is-w-umbrella

pe-is-w-umbrella

To increase icon sizes relative to their container, use the pe-lg (33% increase), pe-2x,pe-3x, pe-4x, or pe-5x classes.
To align the icon at the middle of a text, use the pe-va class.

<p><i class="pe-is-w-umbrella pe-lg pe-va"></i> pe-is-w-umbrella</p>
<p><i class="pe-is-w-umbrella pe-2x pe-va"></i> pe-is-w-umbrella</p>
<p><i class="pe-is-w-umbrella pe-3x pe-va"></i> pe-is-w-umbrella</p>
<p><i class="pe-is-w-umbrella pe-4x pe-va"></i> pe-is-w-umbrella</p>
<p><i class="pe-is-w-umbrella pe-5x pe-va"></i> pe-is-w-umbrella</p>
If your icons are getting chopped off on top and bottom, make sure you have sufficient line-height.

Fixed Width Icons

  •   Temperature 1
  •   Temperature 2
  •   Temperature 3
  •   Temperature 4

Use pe-fw to set icons at a fixed width. Great to use when variable icon widths throw off alignment. Especially useful in things like nav lists. (Reminder: nav list classes in the example are from bootstrap) 

<ul class="nav nav-pills nav-stacked">
  <li><a href="#"><i class="pe-is-w-thermometer-4 pe-fw"></i> Temperature 1</a></li>
  <li><a href="#"><i class="pe-is-w-thermometer-3 pe-fw"></i> Temperature 2</a></li>
  <li class="active"><a href="#"><i class="pe-is-w-thermometer-2 pe-fw"></i> Temperature 3</a></li>
  <li><a href="#"><i class="pe-is-w-thermometer-1 pe-fw"></i> Temperature 4</a></li>
</ul>

List Icons

  • List icons (like these)
  • can be used
  • to easily replace
  • default bullets in lists

Use pe-ul and pe-li to easily replace default bullets in unordered lists.

<ul class="pe-ul">
  <li><i class="pe-li pe-is-w-moon-first-quarter-f"></i> List icons (like these) </li>
  <li><i class="pe-li pe-is-w-moon-waning-crescent-f"></i> can be used </li>
  <li><i class="pe-li pe-is-w-moon-last-quarter-f"></i> to replace </li>
  <li><i class="pe-li pe-is-w-moon-waning-gibbous-f"></i> default bullets in lists </li>
</ul>

Bordered & Pulled Icons

Use a few styles together and you'll have easy pull quotes or a great introductory article icon.

Use pe-border and pull-right or pull-left for easy pull quotes or article graphics. 

<i class="pe pe-is-w-sun-horizon-2 pe-2x pull-left pe-border"></i>
Use a few styles together and you'll have easy pull quotes or a great introductory article icon.

Spinning Icons

   

Use the pe-spin class to get any icon to rotate. Works well with pe-is-w-sun-1,pe-is-w-moon-3, pe-is-w-full-moon-3 and others.

<i class="pe-is-w-sun-1 pe-spin"></i>
<i class="pe-is-w-moon-3 pe-spin"></i>
<i class="pe-is-w-full-moon-3 pe-spin"></i>

CSS3 animations aren't supported in IE8 - IE9.

Rotated & Flipped

  normal
  pe-rotate-90
  pe-rotate-180
  pe-rotate-270
  pe-flip-horizontal
  pe-flip-vertical

To arbitrarily rotate and flip icons, use the pe-rotate-* and pe-flip-* classes.

<i class="pe-is-w-eclipse-1"></i>&nbsp; normal<br>
<i class="pe-is-w-eclipse-1 pe-rotate-90"></i>&nbsp; pe-rotate-90<br>
<i class="pe-is-w-eclipse-1 pe-rotate-180"></i>&nbsp; pe-rotate-180<br>
<i class="pe-is-w-eclipse-1 pe-rotate-270"></i>&nbsp; pe-rotate-270<br>
<i class="pe-is-w-eclipse-1 pe-flip-horizontal"></i>&nbsp; pe-flip-horizontal<br>
<i class="pe-is-w-eclipse-1 pe-flip-vertical"></i>&nbsp; pe-flip-vertical

Hover Alternate Style


Setting specific content code to any :before pseudo-element you could easily alternate between styles (stroke & filled).

Use pe-fw-h to set icons at a fixed width.

<!-- Stroke to Fill -->
<span class="icon-alt icon-1"></span>
<span class="icon-alt icon-2"></span>
<span class="icon-alt icon-3"></span>
<span class="icon-alt icon-4"></span>
<span class="icon-alt icon-5"></span>
<br>
<!-- Fill to Stroke -->
<span class="icon-alt icon-6"></span>
<span class="icon-alt icon-7"></span>
<span class="icon-alt icon-8"></span>
<span class="icon-alt icon-8"></span>
<span class="icon-alt icon-10"></span>
.icon-alt { font-family: 'pe-icon-set-weather'; margin: 5px; }
.icon-1:before { content: "\e911" }
.icon-1:hover:before { content: "\e90a" }
.icon-2:before { content: "\e9b8" }
.icon-2:hover:before { content: "\e9b7" }
.icon-3:before { content: "\e958" }
.icon-3:hover:before { content: "\e957" }
.icon-4:before { content: "\e929" }
.icon-4:hover:before { content: "\e928" }
.icon-5:before { content: "\e965" }
.icon-5:hover:before { content: "\e968" }
.icon-6:before { content: "\e91c" }
.icon-6:hover:before { content: "\e91d" }
.icon-7:before { content: "\e922" }
.icon-7:hover:before { content: "\e923" }
.icon-8:before { content: "\e959" }
.icon-8:hover:before { content: "\e95a" }
.icon-9:before { content: "\e95b"  }
.icon-9:hover:before { content: "\e95d"  }
.icon-10:before { content: "\e966"  }
.icon-10:hover:before { content: "\e963"  }

Hint: you could find the specific code for every icon in the Reference page. Be sure to check the "Show codes" checkbox on the top bar.
